item.title: Full gas canisters dumped, 23rd November
item.description:
A bag with at least 8 canisters of nitrous oxide has been dumped outside st Nicholas church. They seem full.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Nicholas Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish continually dumped in gated area, 23rd November
item.description:
There is always fly tipping and rubbish in the gated area in front of 1 Alconbury road. Currently there are bags of recycling, cardboard boxes, bricks, parts of an appliance, foam construction material, and logs

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alconbury Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salt/grit bins in this area are empty, 23rd November
item.description:
Salt/grit bins need to be refilled. There has been an update from the Met office indicating a low average temperature for December and an increased risk of snowfall due to this many people in this area especially the old and vulnerable will need access to grit/assault to treat pavements and driveways. Please can this be addressed ASAP?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage, 23rd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, Greater London

item.title: An abandoned vehicle on private land, 23rd November
item.description:
This van has been parked on our land for 4 weeks, we have not seen anyone come to it for us to ask him to move it. In checking DVLA it has a SORN attached and is MOT’d to 11th December. How can we get it removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Bexley, Greater London
